bibl-list.bibl-entry: Brown, M. D., Teich, M. and Kováč, D. (Eds). Slovakia in History. Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2010.
Dobrotková, M., Bekmatov, A., Hečkova, A. C., and Kuciak, J. Slovak Mass Media in the 21st Century: Current Challenges . Berlin, Peter Lang, 2019.
Felak, J. R. After Hitler, Before Stalin: Catholics, Communists and Democrats in Slovakia, 1945-1948 . Pittsburgh, PA, University of Pittsburgh Press, 2009.
Hacker, P. Slovakia on the Road to Independence: An American Diplomat’s Eyewitness Account . University Park, PA, Pennsylvania State University Press, 2010.
Henderson, K. Politics of Slovakia: Voters, Parties and Democracy, 1989-2004 . London, Routledge, 2004.

Hocman, J. Slovakia from the Downfall of Communism to its Accession into the European Union, 1989-2004: The Re-emergence of Political Parties and Democratic Institutions. Frankfurt am Main, Peter Lang, 2011.
Hudek, A., Kopeček, M., and Mervart, J. Czechoslovakism . Abingdon, Routledge, 2022.
Kirschbaum, S. J. History of Slovakia: The Struggle for Survival . New York, St Martin’s Press, 2011.
Historical Dictionary of Slovakia . 3rd edn, Lanham, MD, Scarecrow Press, 2014.
Kšiňan, M. Milan Rastislav Štefánik: The Slovak National Hero and Co-Founder of Czechoslovakia . Abingdon, Routledge, 2021.
Lorman, T. The Making of the Slovak People’s Party: Religion, Nationalism and the Culture War in Early 20th-Century Europe . London, Bloomsbury Academic, 2019.
Marci, Ľ. (Ed.). People, Institutions, Relations: Slovakia and Hungary from the 11th to the 18th Century . Berlin, Peter Lang, 2020.

Nadelsky, N. Defining the Sovereign Community: National Identity, Individual Rights and Minority Membership in the Czech and Slovak Republics . Philadelphia, PA, University of Philadelphia Press, 2009.
Stolarik, M. The Czech and Slovak Republics: Twenty Years of Independence, 1993-2013 . Budapest, Central European University Press, 2016.
van Duin, P. Central European Crossroads: Social Democracy and National Revolution in Bratislava (Pressburg), 1867-1921. New York, Berghahn Books, 2009.
Ward, J. M. Priest, Politician, Collaborator: Jozef Tiso and the Making of Fascist Slovakia . Ithaca, NY, Cornell University Press, 2013.
